intro: Erigeron elborsensis, commonly known as the Elborsen's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron elborsensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions.
